graphicslib3D

Class Vertex3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • graphicslib3D.Vertex3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Vertex3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    Defines a 3D vertex. Every 3D vertex contains a Point3D object representing the geometric location (position) of the vertex in 3D space. Every Vertex3D also contains the following components:
    • a Vector3D representing the "vertex normal"
    • a Color representing the vertex color
    • doubles representing the vertex "texture coordinates" (S,T,P,Q)
    • a Vector3D representing the "vertex tangent"
    • a Vector3D representing the "vertex binormal"
    • a Vector3D representing the vertex "tangent space light vector"
    These additional components are used in various shading algorithms.
    Author:
    John Clevenger
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vertex3D()
      Creates a new Vertex3D with default values.
      Vertex3D(double X, double Y, double Z)
      Creates a new Vertex3D with the specified X,Y,Z location coordinates and default values for other attributes as specified by the no-argument constructor.
      Vertex3D(double X, double Y, double Z, double W)
      Creates a new Vertex3D with the specified X,Y,Z, and W location coordinates and default values for other attributes as specified by the no-argument constructor.
      Vertex3D(Point3D p)
      Creates a new Vertex3D with the X,Y,Z, and W values specified by the given Point3D.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point3D add(Vertex3D v2)
      Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this vertex's location values and the specified vertex's location values.

      Returns a new Object which is a deep clone of this Vertex3D.

      Returns a Vector3D which represents the vector formed by taking the cross product of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z location with the specified vector.

      Returns a Vector3D which represents the vector formed by taking the cross product of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z location with the vector implied by the specified vertex's X,Y,Z location.

      Returns a real number that is the distance between this vertex's location and the specified vertex's location.

      Returns the Vertex3D "binormal" vector.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vertex3D

        public Vertex3D()
        Creates a new Vertex3D with default values. The default location is (0,0,0), with a homogeneous component W=1. The default vertex color is black (0,0,0). The default vertex texture coordinate values are (0,0,0,1). The default values for the vertex normal, tangent, binormal and tangent space light vectors are all null.

      • Vertex3D

        public Vertex3D(double X,
                double Y,
                double Z)
        Creates a new Vertex3D with the specified X,Y,Z location coordinates and default values for other attributes as specified by the no-argument constructor.

      • Vertex3D

        public Vertex3D(double X,
                double Y,
                double Z,
                double W)
        Creates a new Vertex3D with the specified X,Y,Z, and W location coordinates and default values for other attributes as specified by the no-argument constructor.

      • Vertex3D

        public Vertex3D(Point3D p)
        Creates a new Vertex3D with the X,Y,Z, and W values specified by the given Point3D. The given Point3D object is not changed. The new Vertex3D contains default values for other attributes as specified by the no-argument constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public Point3D getLocation()
        Returns a new Point3D object whose location is the same as the location of this Vertex3D. That is, the X,Y,Z,W components of the returned point are the same as the X,Y,Z,W components of the location of this Vertex3D object. Note that what is returned is a new Point3D object, not a reference to the Point3D object contained in this Vertex3D.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns a new Color object whose RGB values are the same as the RGB color values of this Vertex3D object.

      • getNormal

        public Vector3D getNormal()
        Returns a new Vector3D object whose magnitude and direction are the same as the vertex normal of this vertex. The W value in the returned Vector3D is set to 0.0.

      • getNormalX

        public double getNormalX()
        Returns the current value of the X component of the vertex normal.

      • getNormalY

        public double getNormalY()
        Returns the current value of the Y component of the vertex normal.

      • getNormalZ

        public double getNormalZ()
        Returns the current value of the Z component of the vertex normal.

        public double getX()
        Returns the X value of this Vertex3D object's location.

        Returns the Y value of this Vertex3D object's location.

      • getSTPQ

        public double[] getSTPQ()
        Returns a double array containing the S,T,P, and Q components of this Vertex3D object's texture coordinate.

      • getTangent

        public Vector3D getTangent()
        Returns the Vertex3D tangent vector. Note that the tangent vector by default is null; it must be set by the application program.

      • getBinormal

        public Vector3D getBinormal()
        Returns the Vertex3D "binormal" vector. Note that the binormal vector by default is null; it must be set by the application program.

      • getTangentSpaceLightVector

        public Vector3D getTangentSpaceLightVector()
        Returns the Vertex3D tangent space light vector. Note that the tangent space light vector by default is null; it must be set by the application program.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Point3D thePoint)
        Sets the location of this Vertex3D object to be the same as the location of the specified Point3D. That is, the X,Y,Z,W components of the location of this Vertex3D are set to be the same as the X,Y,Z,W values contained in the specified Point3D object. Note that this method does not store a reference to the specified Point3D object -- it copies the X,Y,Z,W values from the Point3D object into the Vertex3D location; subsequent changes to the values of the specified Point3D object will have no effect on this Vertex3D object.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double newX,
                        double newY,
                        double newZ,
                        double newW)
        Sets the location of this Vertex3D object to the specified values.

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double newX,
                        double newY,
                        double newZ)
        Sets the X,Y,Z components of the location of this Vertex3D object to the specified values. The W value is set to 1.0.

      • setNormal

        public void setNormal(Vector3D newNormal)
        Sets the vertex normal of this Vertex3D to a new Vector3D object which is a clone of the specified Vector3D object.

        Sets the vertex normal of this Vertex3D to the specified vector values.

        Sets the tangent of this Vertex3D to the specified vector values.

        public void setTangentSpaceLightVector(Vector3D newVector)
        Sets the Vertex3D tangent space light vector to the specified vector. Note that the tangent space light vector by default is null; it must be set by the application program.

        Sets the P value of this Vertex3D object's texture coordinate to the specified value.

        public void setQ(double newQ)
        Sets the Q value (that is, the homogeneous component) of this Vertex3D object's texture coordinate to the specified value.

      • setST

        public void setST(double newS,
                  double newT)
        Sets the S,T 2D texture coordinate values of this Vertex3D object. This method performs the same operation as method set2DTextureCoordinates().

      • set2DTextureCoordinates

        public void set2DTextureCoordinates(double newS,
                                    double newT)
        Sets the S,T texture coordinate values of this Vertex3D object. This method performs the same operation as method setST().

      • setSTP

        public void setSTP(double newS,
                   double newT,
                   double newP)
        Sets the S,T,P 3D texture coordinate values of this Vertex3D object.

      • setSTPQ

        public void setSTPQ(double newS,
                    double newT,
                    double newP,
                    double newQ)
        Sets the S,T,P,Q 4D texture coordinate values of this Vertex3D object. Note that care should be taken to avoid setting the Q value to zero, since Q represents the homogeneous component of the texture coordinate and may be used in a divide operation.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a new Object which is a deep clone of this Vertex3D.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • minus

        public Point3D minus(Vertex3D v2)
        Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the difference between this vertex's X,Y,Z location values and the specified vertex's X,Y,Z location values. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

      • distanceTo

        public double distanceTo(Vertex3D v2)
        Returns a real number that is the distance between this vertex's location and the specified vertex's location.

      • add

        public Point3D add(Vertex3D v2)
        Returns a new Point3D whose X,Y,Z values are the sum of this vertex's location values and the specified vertex's location values. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

      • mid

        public Point3D mid(Vertex3D v2)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the midpoint between this vertex's location and the specified vertex's location. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

      • mult

        public Point3D mult(double theMultiplier)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the result of multiplying this vertex's X,Y,Z location values by the given multiplier. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

      • div

        public Point3D div(double theDivisor)
        Returns a new Point3D which is the result of dividing this vertex's X,Y,Z location values by the given divisor. The new Point3D's W value is the default W value specified by the no-argument constructor of class Point3D.

      • mult

        public Vertex3D mult(Matrix3D mat)
        Returns a new Vertex3D object which is a clone of this vertex but with a Point3D location generated by multiplying this vertex's location by the specified Matrix3D. Multiplication is done in the order specified by the method Point3D.mult(Matrix3D).

      • scale

        public void scale(double scaleFactor)
        Scales each of the X, Y, and Z components of this vertex's location by the given scaleFactor. Note that this method does NOT return a new Point3D; it scales THIS vertex's X,Y,Z location values. The W value in the vertex location is unchanged.

      • dot

        public double dot(Vertex3D v)
        Returns the value of the "dot product" of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z with the vector implied by the specified vertex's X,Y,Z. Note that the dot product of two vectors is by definition a scalar value; this method returns that scalar as a double. Only the X, Y, and Z values of the vertex are used in computing the returned value; the W component is ignored.

      • cross

        public Vector3D cross(Vertex3D aVertex)
        Returns a Vector3D which represents the vector formed by taking the cross product of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z location with the vector implied by the specified vertex's X,Y,Z location.

      • cross

        public Vector3D cross(Vector3D aVector)
        Returns a Vector3D which represents the vector formed by taking the cross product of the vector implied by this vertex's X,Y,Z location with the specified vector.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a printable representation of this Vertex3D.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
